title.subtitle: A picture of the prices of the classic Buenos Aires combo

modal.text1: The original idea was developed in Estudio Chinchulín, with the production of  @jeremadrazzo and the design of @pilardibujito.
modal.text2: You can find the original infography here.

tables.title: How are things in Buenos Aires?

proportion.title: How much does a coffee with two medialunas cost in Buenos Aires?

reference-table.title: August 2024 Reference
reference-table.subtitle: Dolar Blue exchange rate of 23/08/2024
reference-table.text: Prices updated until 23/8. Don't take this literally, take it easy.

twitts.@HAGOV875: In Constitución ‟El Gordo Valor” sells ‟coffee as usual” with two superb medialunas at 8500 pesos. They accept payments in bitcoin and if you tell them that ‟El Tuerca” sent you, they give you a discount.
twitts.@CandenteMañana: The universe might change but ‟El Británico” never will. $3400.
twitts.@quebracho_castania: In the CECEN it costs $1200. I’ve been having breakfast there everyday for three years.
twitts.@Ericpulgar_: Some crispy $1500. It isn’t a tracendental grastronomical experience but having breakfast while you look at a gigantography of Dibu Martinez sounds like a good plan. Kinda.
twitts.@Juuli_1995: In ‟Café Martinez” it costs $4150 and the coffee is foamy and sexy.
twitts.@Gordigol69: -Le Pain Quotidien- means the everyday pain in french. $9800 for a coffee with 2 medialunas. Ouch.

little-sign: Built thanks to the contribution of hundreds of internet users
